snippet: Pressure from competitors has compelled the company to make the upgrade free and to find new ways to profit from some of its big moneymakers.
abstract: Microsoft does not plan to charge customers for upgrading to new Windows 10 operating system in sign of how tech industry has changed; company once charged anywhere from $50 to $100 for upgrades, but model has been made obsolete by rise of companies like Google, which offer free software and services; Microsoft's core business remains software, but it has begun to prioritize expanding its user and developer base.
lead_paragraph: Pressure from competitors has compelled the company to make the upgrade free and to find new ways to profit from some of its big moneymakers.

headline.main: Windows 10 Signifies Microsoft’s Shift in Strategy
